tweets.text:
We are already making preparations ahead of the heavy #rain due this week. 

Team are out across the North West making sure rivers are running clear and free from debris. 

Sign up now to receive free flood alerts and warnings ‚ñ∂Ô∏è  https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/oAgHMr9KrN

The #RiverNailbourne is an unusual river that flows along the road, often not flowing for years at a time, when levels become unpassable by car the road is closed and barriers are installed. You will see ‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© #FieldTeams monitoring  daily. https://t.co/6EIDHPTQOY

tweets.text:
In a joint message, @TonyJuniper from @NaturalEngland,
@EmmaHowardBoyd from @EnvAgency and @williamrworsley from @ForestryEngland have declared that this must be the year we ramp up action on climate change and #NatureRecovery.

#TogetherForOurPlanet
https://t.co/imv3CfNn6I

Interesting - I raised this with @EnvAgency as a significant risk due to local topography and building shape for the #Rivenhall waste incinerator. They ignored that and all other objections and gave a permit for a 600ktpa incinerator with a stack just 35m above local ground level https://t.co/2TB2Ow3RmA

tweets.text: Heavy rain is forecast for our District at the beginning of this week. It will combine with snow melt and fall on sodden ground. Our rivers are running high and fast. Please be prepared stay alert and check @EnvAgencyYNE flood warnings regularly. #StaySafe #floodaware https://t.co/ZlN5t16F9l
@WindrushWasp @thameswater @EnvAgency Similar on the Hogsmill https://t.co/YomJNauRda

@WindrushWasp @thameswater @EnvAgency That‚Äôs biological filamentous bacteria on the surface of the pasveer ditches at the STW. A microscopic analysis of the foam on the river could verify if this is similar. Detergents produce a white foam. Healthy biological foaming can occur naturally with agitation.

tweets.text:
We're in the middle of heavy bouts of rain - Yesterday's #weather has moved on, but more is expected from Tuesday...

...Dry conditions, then, to manage one our pumping station near #Sandwich, part of our efforts to help protect homes and businesses from flooding...
#floodaware https://t.co/7jxyovzlvW

A local paper this week said we don't defend #Kent from flooding. Not so. 

We're out all the time clearing blockages, like today: 

#IsleofSheppey, #EastPeckham, and we saw a superb rainbow at #FiveOakGreen.

Please report river debris: 0800 807060
Pix: @DeTom48 
#floodaware https://t.co/0KSBbzi7tU

urls.title: Sign up for flood warnings
urls.description: Register your home or business in England, Scotland or Wales to receive flood warnings and find out how to check flood risk in Northern Ireland

tweets.text:
Here's our #Yorkshire area duty manager Martin on what to expect over the coming days with further rain forecast, snow melt, and the impact that will have on river levels which are already high. 
Make sure you're signed up to #flood warnings: https://t.co/dj5PCHr2lX https://t.co/EYVpWZorV1

The essential maintenance we needed to carry out at Currymoor has been successfully completed this afternoon, we will continue to operate the Sowy over the weekend in preparation for the rain that is forecast for Saturday. #Monksleaze #Sowy #KSD 
@EnvAgencySW https://t.co/lF9V99vKbL

tweets.text:
How to turn a chalk stream into an open sewer, no, I'm not kidding.

The water course on the right is the River Wandle 1 of only 2 urban chalk streams in London. The 1 on the left is the rather aptly named "Beddington Effluent Carrier". https://t.co/0QYDEtY7tB

tweets.text:
The @MetOffice has issued amber & yellow warnings for heavy rain throughout Tuesday & Thursday. 
See flood warnings for Barnsley @EnvAgency or on their website https://t.co/iGLts8BjWH
You can find useful flooding advice & prevention on our website https://t.co/TbjPaHrAvb. https://t.co/7FSsNphr2c

tweets.text:
You: "Thank HEAVENS it's stopped raining!"

True! But more coming on TUESDAY...

That's why we're out checking rivers aren't blocked by trees and debris that can divert water into properties...

Today, in west #Kent ‚¨áÔ∏è from @DeTom48 

Latest flood picture: https://t.co/68FnHpzAay https://t.co/NIjdyxGrdp

@kersten_england @EnvAgencyYNE Not really the news I wanted to here üòûwe are prepared with two pumps in the cellar following Boxing Day Floods 2015, flood barriers purchased items with support from  flood resilience grant from  @bradfordmdc sand bags would be greatly received in preparation üëçüèΩ

The idiots ü§° who permitted the @GlosCC incinerator conveniently "forgot" the building downwash effect... ‚ò†Ô∏è https://t.co/qwGxHGeEJN https://t.co/bbxGqAlNAF

tweets.text: @AndynBrown16 @EnvAgencyNW Looks a rough 36hrs does this across Lancs. Well forced, tropical maritime air, for a time at least, satured surfaces given recent rainfall/snow melt and another 50-100mm within 36hrs signals a bad day on Wed. Add snow and strong winds by Thu morning quite the spell of weather...

tweets.text: Leeds case rate down further to 310 per 100k people - a 13% reduction in a week. Positivity down to 11.3%. Please stay in if you can, wear a mask where required & keep your distance. Weather improving too but keep an eye out for @EnvAgencyYNE for any flood warnings as snow melts
Hendon Waterside #luxuryapartments 17 mins to King‚Äôs Cross by train #London #realestate https://t.co/MCwGpEZdXf https://t.co/QDJXh0L0WK

tweets.text: Incredible public clean-up at Brent Reservoir. Among the tyres & tampons, items found inc a 30 yr-old crisp packet and a shotgun.  @CanalRiverTrust, @BarnetCouncil, @Brent_Council, @EnvAgency & @NaturalEngland now need to step up. Shameful long-term neglect. https://t.co/rGbj9fEKZi

tweets.text: With the water level temporarily lowered by 1m for dam repairs, the dreadful neglect of #SSSI Brent Reservoir (Welsh Harp) is stark. Not enough being done. Act now! | @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @thames21 https://t.co/ojH4magew5
@DeTom48 @salty_sarah @EnvAgencySE @KentHighways I'm sure that was rebuilt last year (or late 2019).

Water from #Ladybower Reservoir is being released to increase storage capacity, ahead of forecast heavy rain Monday pm. 

River levels will rise in the #Derwent, but will not lead to property #flooding. Action taken now allows water to move safely through before further rain. https://t.co/iRDTU6myK9

Heavy rain is forecast this week and flooding across Greater Manchester and the North West is expected. Follow @EnvAgencyNW for more info and sign up to receive their flood warnings now. https://t.co/tbQ54kx65o
